column2: Immediate Requirement for  TSO - Tele Sales Officer for one of the leading Insurance company   Position : TSO Qualification : Intermediate / Any Graduate Experience : Min - - 6 year of experience in Tele calling / Tele sales Salary : Freshers 15-17K + Incentives; Experienced - based on last CTC + Incentive Locations : Hyderabad, Begumpet ; 6 days working ( 9am to 6pm ) Languages : Hindi, English JOB SUMMARY - Insurance Telecaller is a person who sells insurance policies. Insurance Sales Representative calls and meets with clients and potential clients to grow their customer base. The Insurance Sales Representative goal is to get information about clients' needs and match them with insurance policies they offer. Job description : Research and source potential clients and build long-term relationships with them Persuade prospective clients to engage in a phone conversation and/or meeting to discuss insurance products Advise clients on the insurance policies that best suit their needs Customize insurance programs to suit individual clients Deliver approved policies to new clients and explain benefits and risks of the policy Re-assess the policy needs of existing clients after life-changing events Fill-out and submit applications, issue quotes, maintain client records and prepare reports Keep abreast of industry and market trends and best practices. Interested candidates share cv to : busiraju.sindhu@manpower.co.in  Whats app : 7013970562

column1: Job Vacancies For US Mortgage Process, Residential Mortgage
column2: We are hiring for MNC Client  Hiring for   US Mortgage Process (Residential Mortgage Process)    Professional work experience of 2 to 6.5 Year Shift Time- 5PM TO 2:30AM Location: Chennai   What would you do Candidates will be aligned to our  Financial Services and mortgage banking vertical which is focused on helping clients with their mortgage loans. They will be working as a part of Pre-Foreclosure milestone Review Team where they would be evaluating the processing adherence to regulatory / procedural / client requirements of Loss mitigation agent decisions. Below are the steps outlining the process: Performs ongoing, structured, and rigorous review of loans prior to foreclosure referral and foreclosure sale to identify exceptions in loss mitigation processing and customer interactions. Examines  Loss Mitigation processes for accuracy, completeness, and compliance with investor/insurer guidelines. Candidates with prior work experience in mortgage servicing domain preferably into  Foreclosure and Loss mitigation processes. Preferred domain skills:   Ability to read and understand mortgage servicing regulatory requirements at the federal level such as (Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, Telephone Consumer Protection Act, Unfair, Real Estate Settlement Procedures Act, Unfair, Deceptive or Abusive Acts or Practices, Equal Credit Opportunity Act)   Ability to understand lifecycle of a defaulted loan and the various programs within it (loan type  Fannie, Freddie, FHA, USDA, VA) (various waterfall requirements for a borrower  repayment plan, forbearance, deferment, modification, short sale, and deed in lieu)   Detailed navigation within our system of record (BKFS) to tie loans to phone calls.   Distinguish between different Delinquency levels.   Determine the correct investor as different investors have different requirements.   In this role the candidate will be working on loans part of Mortgage Servicing and Default management portfolios like  Loss mitigation, Foreclosure, Bankruptcy, Escrow analysis, Investor reporting and Credit Bureau Reporting etc.  They are required to do production or testing of existing quality controls to ensure regulatory / procedural compliance. Perks and benefits  2Ways Cab will be provided Virtual Interview Interested Candidate Share Updated Resume on below Email ID's gayathri_s@trigent.com  Contact Numbers: 8073564703
column11: Us Residential Mortgage, US Mortgage, Loss Mitigation, foreclosure, Residential, Loan Processing, residential mortgage, Loan Servicing

column1: Associate Consultant, Reporting & Data Analysis- Ceded Reinsurance
column2: What will your essential responsibilities include? Prepare and support on monthly & quarterly reports. Develop dashboards by understanding Business specifications and translating them into automated modules wherever possible. Prepare external reports templates for treaties placed which include collecting data from finance and actuaries and put it in the required template format. Detailed in-depth analysis of reinsurance contracts, Interpret and translate data to reporting requirements & conduct analysis. Develop and help automate the existing and new reporting requirements, keeping them standardized, but flexible enough to incorporate last minute changes and adjustment in fast moving reporting environment. Support the designing, modeling and maintenance of dashboard for Ceded Re function. Manage the data extraction and report running out of various operational reporting tools and databases including Cognos, MIS, SQL etc. Participate in projects as required to ensure that all potential impacts to financial data are identified and managed effectively. Ensure proper documentation and audit trail for all the reports prepared. Maintain strong communication with onshore (both written and verbal) and manage expectations. Handling adhoc queries related to the process or new projects as and when required. Identify process improvements, make and implement recommendations to streamline the process.  Collation and management of department procedure manuals and process documentation. Were looking for someone who has these abilities and skills: Intermediate to advance knowledge of MS office tools like Excel & Access (Pivot, charts etc.) is a must. Working knowledge of SQL is added advantage. Strong Insurance and Re-insurance Knowledge Excellent analytical and trouble-shooting skills and ability to analyze and manipulate huge volume of financial and operational data Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet tight deadlines Possess excellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skills Makes recommendations to management on new processes, tools and techniques, or development of new products and services Possesses skills and awareness and consistent basic project management, analytical and application skills Consistently determines and executes basic research and/or referrals independently Analytical, communication & interpersonal skills

column2: What will your essential responsibilities include? Providing comprehensive assistance to the underwriter and guidance to the coding and Issuance Unit if such exists, throughout the policy lifecycle. Pre-underwriting, evaluating risk, and assessing the completeness of the underwriting package before the underwriter is required to review. Managing the workflow of multiple tasks and maintaining a detailed understanding of the status of various tasks owned by the underwriter, Brokers, Reinsurers AXA XL internal network and fronting partners, and network partners around the world. Proactive problem-solving to balance and manage client/broker/UW expectations and internal service standards. Acting as a Subject Matter Expert and a role model on the process tools used and/or providing long-term support to the other members on top of daily duties. Collaborating closely with the Underwriter, Project Management, legal and Regulatory as necessary to perform pre/post-blind activities and confirm policy issuance instructions and manuscript wordings, Regulatory notices, certificates etc. to effectively instruct the Coding and Issuance unit if, such exists. Assessing when necessary and performing quality control of rating, coding, and issuance output to ensure accuracy (e.g., exposure basis, limits, coverage extensions, modifications and data entry etc.). Training and mentoring the new team member to support their learning, as well as for the coding & Issuance unit if, such exists. Conducting sessions for ESS teams to boost knowledge and enhance effectiveness across the organization. Preparing and maintaining documentation of the existing and future processes, including detailed process maps (as and when required) Constantly challenging existing processes, looking for improvement opportunities and participating in process improvement projects between ESS and MO/UW. Actively supporting transition planning & execution. Looking to engage in projects and opportunities to collaborate with other individuals/teams onshore and offshore. Adhering to Service Level Agreements and quality targets set by Global Operations in agreement with Underwriting (when applicable) Using workflow and time-tracking tools to ensure proper work organization and reporting (when applicable). Supporting in different time zone to provide coverage to business as applicable.  Were looking for someone who has these abilities and skills: Required Skills and Abilities: Graduate in any discipline, preferably in insurance and Commerce or Financial & Accounting.   Candidate with relevant years of experience within AXA XL or the Insurance domain.  Very good knowledge of Insurance/Underwriting.  Effective knowledge of policy management tools.  Proficient in reading and comprehending Insurance industry-related correspondence and memos.  Excellent written and oral communication skills and confidence to speak up in team meetings as well as with senior colleagues and stakeholders.  Problem-solving attitude, great work organization skills.  Effective analytical skills and ability to work resiliently and under my own initiative.  Should be deadline-driven and can work under pressure.  Ability to perform the processes with zero supervision.   Ability to support the team manager from the technical perspective as an SME. Technical knowledge, Social Intelligence, Result-Outcome focus, Analytical Thinking, Client Service and Negotiating and Persuading.

Ensuring the supporting documents for the key control evidence are e-filed in Documentum. Organizing calls with the London/Exton/Paris LoB handlers to discuss processes, document resolution and implement action plans and report thereof. Own the end-to-end processing and sending for next level review. This includes reinsurance contract set up, premium payment request, communication etc. Perform commentary on Large claim Alerts. Take responsibility to update in the log. Respond to broker queries and collaborate with Ceded Technical accounting. First review the initial loss notification and collection notes. Review and comment against key Captive Accounts within the regime are reviewed and feedback provided asap. Responsible for sending out QS RI Statement of accounts. Update QS trackers. Job Summary. As a Global Insurance Specialist, you will be responsible for managing insurance-related matters for our company on a global scale. You will work closely with internal teams and external insurance providers to ensure adequate coverage and compliance with insurance regulations in various regions. Your role will involve analysing risks, negotiating insurance contracts, and implementing insurance strategies to protect the company's interests worldwide. Roles & Responsibilities. Insurance Analysis: Conduct comprehensive assessments of the company's insurance needs across different regions and business units. Policy Management: Manage insurance policies including renewals, amendments, and cancellations to ensure continuous coverage. Risk Assessment: Identify potential risks and liabilities associated with the company's operations globally and develop strategies to mitigate them. Claims Handling: Coordinate the processing of insurance claims, liaising with insurers and relevant stakeholders to ensure timely resolution. Contract Negotiation: Negotiate insurance contracts and terms with insurers to obtain the most favourable coverage and pricing for the company. Compliance: Stay updated with insurance regulations and compliance requirements in various jurisdictions to ensure adherence to legal and regulatory standards. Vendor Management: Establish and maintain relationships with insurance brokers, carriers, and other service providers to optimize insurance offerings and services. Reporting: Prepare regular reports and presentations on insurance-related metrics, claims status, and risk assessments for management review. Training and Education: Provide guidance and training to internal teams on insurance-related matters, policies, and procedures. Continuous Improvement: Continuously evaluate and improve insurance processes and procedures to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Qualifications. Education: Bachelors degree in business administration, Finance, Risk Management, or a related field. Advanced degree or professional certifications such as CPCU, ARM, or ACII preferred. Experience: Minimum of 5 years of experience in insurance management, risk management, or related roles, with a strong understanding of global insurance practices and regulations. Industry Knowledge: Deep knowledge of insurance products, including property, casualty, liability, and employee benefits, as well as experience working with various types of insurance policies and coverages. Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to assess risks, analyse insurance contracts, and develop effective insurance strategies. Negotiation Skills: Proven ability to negotiate insurance contracts, terms, and pricing with insurers to obtain favourable outcomes for the company. Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex insurance concepts clearly and effectively to internal and external stakeholders. Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail and accuracy in reviewing insurance documents, policies, and claims to ensure compliance and minimize risks. Team Player: Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities, deadlines, and business needs, with a proactive and solution-oriented approach. Ethical Standards: High ethical standards and integrity, with a commitment to upholding ethical practices and confidentiality in handling insurance matters.
column11: Insurance Claims, Marine Insurance, Claims Management, Claim Adjudication, Insurance Underwriting, Insurance Broking, Insurance Operations, Cargo Handling, Claim Settlement, Vehicle Insurance, Motor Insurance
